November 17, 1959
Dr. Harry Skornia
Executive Director
NAEB
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
I am not quite certain how to respond to your memorandum of November 6,
in the light of the feelings of the research committee expressed in our
annual report* If we were to take one of the suggestions in this report,
the one which seems to me would be of greatest benefit to the greatest
number of NAEB members, I would take as the project or goal of this
committee to encourage and upgrade research among the member institutions
through the establishment of a team of research consultants* This team
of consultants could provide a member institution with help in;
Determining its research needs*
2. Planning long-range programs of research
3. Laying out specific research designs
4. Drawing up research proposals for obtaining financial aid
when necessary
5. Evaluating research results.
I believe that the Ford Foundation might be interested in such a group,
if the consultants were of sufficient ability, because of many of their
experiences with giving grants to institutions which did not know fehat to
do with the research funds after they got them. I would think that they
might be approached on such a project* I believe that the Title VII
personnel might also be approached, namely Roy Hall and Walter Stone* One
of their problems is that many of the potentially good research proposals
are coming from persons completely lacking in research sophistication*
With proper guidance, some of these persons could make an important conÂ¬
tribution. The Department of Health, Education, and Welfare is not in a
position to provide this guidance* An outside agency, sustained in part
by Department funds, I would think could provide tnis help*
